tweets.text: @ab4scambs @EnvAgency While the Conservative agenda is Build back better and housing in this area continues to expand, note the Barton Road proposals for 2,800 homes, there will always be a water shortage!

Oh god, double whammy - pollution event no2 - pumping  polluted water from crushed concrete into #ShuttertonBrook - watched them doing it. I‚Äôm so sick of people abusing the Environment, seems endless and who is monitoring them? @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW #Dawlish #Devon https://t.co/g9FzlzbLKH

@stewart_mounsey @EnvAgency @CumbriaCC more signage needed at burneside road. Many people trying to get into town this way only to have to turn back to Burneside road. Many elderly upset of extra steps. If you could address that would really help the community. Thanks https://t.co/avf7TqXImn

Blackwater Valley protected habitats.   @dioceseoflondon website says, "There may never have been a time since the Ice Age when wild nature was so severely under threat."  So work WITH nature, don't tear up 400 acres https://t.co/fKw3aISMeE

urls.title: Recycling one million tonnes of water in Felixstowe
urls.description: EA Local Project Manager Harri Condie, discusses how stakeholders have come together to improve Felixstone.

tweets.text:
Our project to recycle up to 1 million tonnes of water is helping reduce pressure on water supplies in Suffolk.

It will:
üöú take water drained from fields 
üå± pump the water 12km to irrigate crops
ü¶Ü protect sensitive saltmarsh and wildlife

Read more: https://t.co/dpvqMJIBT4

@graffitology @RussellB1ggs @GeorgeMonbiot @EnvAgency It is definitely still happening despite 2020 regulation supposedly there to get people to stop doing it. People haven't bothered to replace/upgrade and the @EnvAgency don't even know who still has septic tanks discharging directly to watercourses üôÑ
Conifers? Surely not. Have @ForestryEngland really learnt no lessons in 50 years? @EnvAgencySW  @ChrisGPackham https://t.co/wwT8WdY2fZ

@BirdygirlDevon @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW I‚Äôm getting where I‚Äôd believe anything now, this is not what you expect in 2021 - just dumping polled water into a stream which flows directly into a Special Protected Area and Wildlife refuge

@Kristin11277193 @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW Thank you Kristine, I do hope so as it feels a bit overwhelming at the moment. People get paid to write all these guidelines and environmental management plans then people just ignore them, wildlife suffers - that‚Äôs so wrong

@RussellB1ggs @AgainstSewage @GeorgeMonbiot @EnvAgency I did the same. When I bought my house 10 years ago it was pumping human sewage straight into a stream that fed a river where kids paddle. I‚Äôm sure there are still properties doing the same. A friends kids also got very ill from playing in the river.

Internation Webinar on 23-24 Feb 21 on Novel Alternative Therapies to Counter Antimicrobial Resistance. It may prove as Mythbusters to some and way forward to others.
You may register to hear and participate to express your view and criticism at https://t.co/ddyAFO8Z8s #AMR #MDR

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: MythBusters
entity.description: So exactly how hard is it to find a needle in a haystack, anyway? And can water dripping on your forehead really drive you nuts? Those are the kinds of questions, myths and urban legends that are put to the test in this humorous series that seeks to find out which myths are true and which are not.

urls.title: Flood Alert, Flood Warning and Severe Flood Warning ‚Äì What‚Äôs the difference? | Newground
urls.description: Recently, I saw a poll on Twitter set up to help the Environment Agency understand people‚Äôs interpretation of flood risk, which is one of the reasons I decided to write this blog. Out of the 1,199 people who voted on the poll, I was quite shocked to find that 51% of voters thought a Flood Alert meant that you were at a higher risk of flooding than a Flood Warning. This is NOT the case. Raising awareness of the flood alerts and warning system and what each stage means is key to educating people and

tweets.text:
Having a 'trigger' to notify you of a #flood BEFORE it happens can allow time to prepare.

The @EnvAgencyNW Flood Warning Service is one such trigger, but do you know what the different stages mean?

Read our blog to learn more: https://t.co/5Hv1sf3FoV

#preparedness #floodaware https://t.co/7SEKTJFMnd

As as part of the programme of recovery to last month‚Äôs #floods, #TeamEA and our partners have started work to repair an embankment on the River Alt @LuntMeadows Nature Reserve and flood storage area. 

Read all about it here ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/5v1GOUIPv1 https://t.co/9H7ssFKrHe

Our Field Team have been busy in #Leyland today removing this big tree from the River Lostock!

Using a motorised winch and chainsaws, the team successfully got the tree out of the watercourse and reduced the potential #flood risk to nearby properties. https://t.co/3Z6I1bH9eR
@ab4scambs @BenHattonJourno @EnvAgency Good work but a massive Growth Agenda in this region pushed by your government is only going to make the situation very much worse. @cam_friends

@JoKingDevon @Feargal_Sharkey @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW It's happening nationwide as the polluters either get away with it or the fines are so small it's worth there while doing it. To me it seems like polluting rivers is a part of many companies business plans to cut costs.

We're collaborating with @RG_Parkins on an exciting #nfm flood storage design & build project for @SCRiversTrust in partnership with @NTsouthlakes & @CumbriaCC #LLFA @EnvAgencyNW & the local community. Earth bunds with adjustable orifice plates, leaky dams & skylighting a culvert https://t.co/iPjU1tysgw

tweets.text: @ab4scambs @EnvAgency I don't know any waterway in this area that isn't full to the brim or overflowing.   In 2 months time though things will be very different and we'll probably back to drought conditions.  Timing seems a bit off.

@trent900uk @EnvAgencySE believe this may fall in to your remit this has been ongoing since 2012 with various court cases and complaints about time it was sorted out @HertsMercury maybe time to run a series of story‚Äôs on this again?
Anyone? https://t.co/b8GHhDyNQZ

Work has begun to stabilise a riverbank damaged after the collapse of a weir at Newlay, near Leeds. The damage has not increased the immediate risk of flooding to local properties, but the works are required to prevent any further erosion and longer term flood risk. https://t.co/DJZkw0Ndxb

@Aeolianharpist @holnicoteNH @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW It actually got worse than this video showed when the pump ramped up to full force it just gushed out of the pipe but I was so shocked I just ran to go and find the source rather than stand and film - they stopped as soon as I spoke to them thankfully
@JoKingDevon @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW @Dunne4Ludlow @CommonsEAC these incidents are every bit as polluting as pumping out raw sewage.
